ygData.subject: Re: Warriors vs Hybrids
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Gang, Just a couple of things to ask right now. Last night i was in lake rathe with my cleric hoping to score some bronze plate from some drybones. I was
ygData.messageBody:
Hey Gang,

Just a couple of things to ask right now. Last night i was in lake rathe
with my cleric hoping to score some bronze plate from some drybones. I was
in a duo with a level 17 Necromancer and it was going really sweet. During
the day time we would head over to the Aviak treehouse near Jonah Brucker
and slaughter birds and when night would approach wed go back to the Karana
Zone area and take out skels. OK so we started off in day time having a
blast killing aviaks every 1 minute cause they spawn so damn fast there and
were earning exp like no tomorrow. THen night comes along and we head over
to the undead area. We start off killing a few skeletons gaining some exp
but not too much and wait around for the first drybones to come.

After about 5 minutes Voila there he is. I call him over with expulse undead
for 91 damage and then the necro sends in his pet to tank and i back off
hitting it 5 more times all for 91 damage while the necro is using his DoT
spells like heat blood heart flutter and clingin darkness. The thing was at
about 1/4 of health left when another skel spawns and starts attacking it
too. Now this didnt bother me at all at first. I gave it one more Expulse
undead giving the killing blow and what do i see? NO EXP and the corpse
dissapears. I rub my eyes and check again,...nope nothing. So i scroll back
up seeing if that other skeleton had perhaps got the killing blow which
would make sense. But no, i haad indeed got the blow in. Infact the Normal
skele had only hit the drybones once and it was for 16 damage.

So why the heck did we not get to loot the corpse and get no exp?

Ok next up. After killing a couple more drybones and actually getting some
bronze day time came again and we headed back to our aviak killing grounds,.
When we arrived we saw two Rangers there and decided to let them have it. No
biggie we said we can go kill Jonah Brucker for kicks. (and water --- those
who know who Jonah is will know what im talking about ) so we get there and
sure enough Good ol Jonah is there waiting. He cons blue to me (level 17
cleric) and he is a monk. I know this because he uses strike. On average he
hits for about 20 damage max on me. My necro friend was afk for one second
while i was engaging Jonah, who i can normally kill with no problems. I
call him out and he runs up to me with a dagger in hand. Odd i think to
myself, must be a rare weapon or something. All of a sudden i see my heatlth
begin to plummet as Jonah is peircing me for 36 and always, ALWAYS getting
double attack in.

I couldnt belive it, i could not even heal myself. When i died he latched
onto my necro friend who then suffered the same fate. Well we were bound on
the same spot that we died on so we memed our spells and then killed him.

Why was a monk that conned blue to me kicking my ass with a rusty dagger?
Thats what his dagger was by the way.



Ok next up. We decide Jonah sucks and decide to explore a little bit before
heading back over to the undead spawn spot. We pass near the barbarian
village and my friend gets to close. Three of them latch on to him and he
has to engage them. I come along to help and see that they all con blue to
me so we start fighting away and eventually win. No biggie, no factions go
up or down or anything. We rest and med up and explore some more. We come
across another inlet that has two human guards wearing plate with no
weapons. They con indifferent and blue to me but i keep my distance just to
be safe. All of a sudden one of the two guards comes runnning up to me and
startsto fight me, first attack i dodged so i say oh well no where to run to
so may as well kill the guard. Then it hits me.....The guard punches me
PUNCHES me twice (double attack) for 98 damage! HOLY #&$%! Run i yell to my
buddy and he casts invis on himself as i watch myself die.

Someone explain this to me. Why is a guard that cons blue to a level 17
cleric hitting me for more than a sand giant would? Just curious.

Oh well i shouldnt complain, i died twice last night in lake rathe but in 3
hours there i made 4 bubbles of exp (after dying even! ) I suggest you all
go there at around level 17 it rocks. Aside from the crap that goes on
there.

Anyways let me know if anyone can explain this stuff to me

Thanks

RayneT'Kazz
